citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
A brown and red adult guinea pig in pen 6 was observed with an eye abnormality and was in need of veterinary care. The
right eye was swollen and held closed. There was swelling and redness of the eyelids and tissues around the eye and
there was a significant amount of yellow discharge inside and around the eye. The licensee had not observed the
abnormal eye and was not administering any treatments. The Program of Veterinary Care on file did not specifically
address the condition.
Eye abnormalities can affect the vision, can be indicative of disease or injury, can be painful, and affect the overall health
and well-being of the animal.
The facility must contact the attending veterinarian to have the guinea pig with the eye abnormality evaluated in order to
determine an appropriate plan for diagnosis and treatment.
Correct by: March 2, 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
End Section

narrative:
2.40(b)(3)  Direct
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
A brown and red adult guinea pig in pen 6 was observed with an eye abnormality and was in need of veterinary care. The 
right eye was swollen and held closed. There was swelling and redness of the eyelids and tissues around the eye and 
there was a significant amount of yellow discharge inside and around the eye. The licensee had not observed the 
abnormal eye and was not administering any treatments.  The Program of Veterinary Care on file did not specifically 
address the condition. 
Eye abnormalities can affect the vision, can be indicative of disease or injury, can be painful, and affect the overall health 
and well-being of the animal.   
The facility must contact the attending veterinarian to have the guinea pig with the eye abnormality evaluated in order to 
determine an appropriate plan for diagnosis and treatment. 
Correct by:  March 2, 2023 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
End Section
